title: Intensive Short-Term Programming Course: Mobile-Based Algorithm Design and Scientific Problem-Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and logical reasoning skills. Basic understanding of the scientific inquiry process (hypothesis formation, variable control, data analysis)
context.additional_context: Mobile-based training course accessible via smartphones for office/administrative professionals, requiring lightweight content design for hands-on practice in PC-free environments. Case-centered instructional design utilizing real-world scientific problems (e.g., energy consumption optimization, public health data analysis).

learning_goals: Learners design sequential algorithms (≤3 steps, e.g., multiplication table output, maximum value identification) using basic programming syntax (variables, conditionals, loops) and implement them in Python/JavaScript to pass ≥80% of test cases, applying scientific inquiry methods (hypothesis → experiment → measurement → analysis) to evaluate code efficiency.

Understanding and applying object-oriented programming (OOP) concepts (classes, inheritance, polymorphism) in mobile environments: designing classes and implementing polymorphism to process real scientific data (e.g., temperature readings, experimental results).
Cultivating problem-solving skills through Java-based coding and debugging: case studies in scientific domains like medical data analysis or environmental monitoring simulations.

Learners collaborate with 2–3 teammates for one week to complete a mini-project on GitHub/GitLab, demonstrating collaboration competencies via ≥5 code shares, ≥3 tracked/ resolved team collaboration issues. Project topics focus on scientific problems (e.g., weather data visualization, biodiversity analysis).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
